alert.note: Alert for Pike; Walthall (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 09 at 7:19AM CST until February 11 at 5:08AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Mississippi... Bogue Chitto River Near Tylertown affecting Pike and Walthall Counties. For the Bogue Chitto River...including Tylertown, Bush...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Bogue Chitto River Near Tylertown. * WHEN...From this morning to early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Secondary roads in the vicinity of the river will flood. Homes close to the river and portions of the Hidden Springs Resort Park will be flooded. Low-lying farm and pasture land near the river will remain flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 AM CST Thursday the stage was 15.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.0 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.1 feet on 01/01/1989. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
